caption.p: ZIKV mutant molecular clones. In ( a), schematic representation of mutant viral clones BR15 E-MUT and MR766 E-MUT and their respective parental clones. In ( b), histograms showing viral titres. Values represent means and standard errors of three independent experiments. In ( c), examples of infectious plaques developed for BR15 E-MUT and MR766 E-MUT, and parental clones, after plaque-forming assay on Vero cells. In ( d), Vero cells were infected with parental and mutant molecular clones (MR766 and BR15) at a MOI of 1. 24 h post-infection (hpi), cells were then lysed and subjected to an immunoblot, in non-reducing conditions. Anti-ZIKV EDIII immunoblot shows differences of electrophoretic mobility associated with residue mutations.
